1.title: Lardil Earth
1.plot: Travel into the traditional homelands of the Lardil people of Mornington Island, where they share a special relationship with Mother Earth that began when the land was created by their ancestors in the Dreamtime.

2.title: The Gubaw Gizul of Saibai
2.plot: The Gubaw Gizul of Saibai is an insight into the totemic kinship connection that each clan of Saibai has with a specific directional wind, and the integral role the winds play in the everyday life and culture of Torres Strait Islanders.

3.title: Yalanji Fire
3.plot: Yalanji Fire, explores the relationship the Yalanji People have with fire, and their Country, Culture and community of Wujal Wujal in Far North Queensland Australia. The traditional practice of fire burning has been passed down through the generations of the Yalanji people. Wujal Wujal Elder Aunty Kathy takes us on a journey into her traditional fire practices, while Mayor Desmond and Ranger Vincent share their knowledge of fire as a vital life source.

4.title: Dauan Island Springs of Life
4.plot: On the small Island of Dauan in the north west of the Torres Strait, spirituality and culture is deeply connected to the environment. Like all Torres Strait Islanders, the people of Dauan maintain a strong cultural connection to island and sea country. Every aspect of life on Dauan is highly dependent on the rhythm of the water - from the sea, sky, and even from within the island itself. At the heart of the island is more than six natural fresh water springs, which have sustained the people of Dauan for thousands of years.

locations: Dauan Island, Torres Strait Islands, Queensland, Australia
imdb.title: Elements
plot: A unique journey into Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Culture and Country through the four elements of Earth, Water, Wind and Fire.
